9.3.19  4:46 am   What inspired you to make songs

      songs are a superpower

9.3.19  4:26 am   Are we real????

      what does real mean

9.3.19  12:44 am   Hi Bill,

I recently tried transcribing a piece, but the guitars were pretty soft and I'm not sure if I caught all the notes. Would you mind looking it over?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?reload=9&v=qySn2yDBKUg (plays twice)

4 bar lines

(Intro)

5/1 4/1 5/1 4/1 (rule the world)

(Main)

5/1 4/1 5/1 4/1

5/1 4/1 5/1 4/1

6min 4 1 1sus 1 1sus

     those seem to be 4/1 not 1sus4 but close enough

      6min 4 5sus

     i think i'd prefer to say 57sus here

      i1 17

     definitely prefer to say b7 over 1

      4maj7 4min(maj7)

3min7 6min

     6min7 but close enough

      2min9 4/5

     would prefer to say 57sus4, and if you're saying actual triads, then you might as well notate it because there's a couple different triads there, but good enough

      1 17 4maj7 4min(maj7)

3min7 6min 2min9

     also i would say 2min7, not seeing it necessary to say 2min9, i'm actually not hearing that

      4/5

     also, i might want to say, for those 4min(maj)7, it is extremely tempting for me to just call that 4min6, because that's what the melody is doing. whether or not the guitar is actually playing it as 4min(maj7) underneath there is open for debate, i defintely don't hear it the second time, i might hear it the first time. if i were charting this for a band i would definitely just say 4min6 just to make sure everyone's on board, the important thing is to stop them from playing min7 on there and min6 will certainly be exactly what's needed

      you're the aliens. it's your choice

9.2.19  10:06 pm   Hey Bill, I had a question about chord names. If say you had, lowest to highest,

C E G A

Would you call that C6 or Amin7/C?

     could be C6 or Amin7, but i wouldn't say "over C" unless the C was truly low enough to feel like a bass note, and if it is, then the other notes should be at least an octave above or else i would call it mush

      C Eb G A

Cmin6 or Ahalfdim7/C? (Amin7(b5)/C)

     with no bass note it's not entirely clear, but by default i think Cmin6 is the most obvious way to put it

      And if one over the other, when would you use the other label?

Much thanks

     the note under the slash is supposed to be a bass note. if it's right in there in the same range as the chord, then it's not really gonna feel like a bass note

9.2.19  6:25 pm   when writing songs, is it okay for songs not to be grammatically correct.

     you'll have to try it and see

      in john legend's song, green light ft andre 3000. one of the lines of andre was him quoting a girl saying, "what type of girl do you think that i are. the kind that you meet in a bar?"

he rhymed 'are' with 'bar' because 'am' doesn't rhyme with it.

does it matter?

      i love that line, but the important question is, do you

9.2.19  4:47 pm   how to get more excited about creating what i love  the most over consuming what i love the most, I suspect that the main thing tampering the excitement in the first is how tiring it is when things aren't going the way I wish they were whilst creating. Maybe the real problem is expectations?

      you'll have to just consume a little bit more until the desire to create becomes just a bit more unbearable

That's some scary stuff.
